alert.note: Alert for Essex (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:49PM EDT until July 12 at 9:42AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Vermont, including the following counties, Caledonia, Essex and Orleans. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Island Pond, Lyndon, St. Johnsbury, East Haven, Ferdinand, Newark, Newark Hollow, Burke, Victory, Granby, Brighton, West Burke Village, Kirby, Brunswick, Maidstone State Park, Sutton, Lyndonville Village, Maidstone, Lunenburg and Westmore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
